message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SI, cs.DS, cs.CV 

This paper proposes a novel framework for improving the performance of Graph Convolutional Networks (GCNs) on incomplete and noisy graphs. The paper focuses on machine learning applications and leverages both content features of nodes and linkage patterns across graphs. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper introduces a GCN-based graph revision module for predicting missing edges and revising edge weights, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.SI (Social and Information Networks). The paper also deals with incomplete and noisy graphs, which could place it in cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) sub-categories.
